questions.text: Vent pipes protect fixture traps against _____.

The diameter of an individual vent sha lI not be less than _____.
The distance “X” in the sketch above shall be at least _____.
The acceptable method for connecting a vent pipe to a horizontal drain pipe is shown above by _____.
The vent pipe opening is above the crown weir of the trap in _____.
A 2-inch vent pipe will serve a total of _____.
Each vent pipe or stack sha lI extend through its flashing and shall terminate vertically above the roof at least _____.
Refer to question 12. The distance from the vent pipe opening to any vertical surface shall be at least _____.
Horizontal termination of vents from any open able window, door opening, air in take or vent shaft shall be not less than _____.
Except for alleys and streets, vent termination from a lot line shall not be less than _____.
Vents terminating in roof areas used for sunbathing shall be extended above the roof at least _____.
Joints at the roof around vent pipes shall be made watertight by the use of _____.
Parallel vent stacks are required for drainage stacks that extend above the building drain _____.
The parallel vent stack shall be connected to the drainage stack by means of a _____.
The pipe size for the common vent serving lavatories installed back-to-back shall be not less than _____ inch(es).
Horizontal vent pipes shall be level or so graded as to drip back by gravity to _____.
The minimum size vent pipe that may serve a 4-inch trap is _____.
Increasing vents one pipe size wiI l _____.
Changes in direction of vent piping sha lI be made by _____.
A drainage stack extends 14 stories above the building drain and is served by a parallel vent stack. A relief yoke vent connection between the vent stack and the drainage stack is required at _____.
The fitting that is required for making the yoke vent intersection with the drainage stack is a _____.
Referring to question 26 above, the size of the yoke vent shall be _____.

options.text: not less in diameter than either the drainage or the vent stack, whichever is smaller
two pipe sizes larger than the drain line
two pipe sizes smaller than the drain line

questions.text: If,due to structural conditions,horizontal vents are less than 6 inches above the overflow rim of the fixture, the horizontal portion shall be installed with _____.

options.text: approved drainage material and fittings and grade to drain

questions.text: Vent terminals in locations having minimum design temperatures below 0 F shall be a minimum of.

options.text: one pipe size larger than normally required

questions.text: Copper tube shall not be used for _____.
ABS or PVC DWV piping installations exposed within ducts or plenums shall be limited to a flame-spread index of not more than 25 or a smoke developed index of 50 except for _____.

options.text: structures not over three floors above grade

questions.text: Sheet lead used for flashings of vent terminals shall be not less than _____.
Section A refers to _____.

options.text: a combination waste and vent system
an indirect waste and vent system

questions.text: The pipe section between the kitchen sink inlet and the lavatory inlet (point “A”) serves as a _____.

options.text: vent pipe for the kitchen sink

questions.text: The total number of fixture units at point “B” is _____.
The vent section “B” shall be a minimum pipe size of _____.
ln this type of installation, the diameter of the lavatory trap arm _____.

options.text: shall be increased one pipe size
shall be increased two pipe sizes
may be decreased one pipe size

questions.text: The sketch represents _____.
The pipe section at “A” is called a _____.
The fitting at “B” is a _____.
The minimum size (diameter) at “C” is _____.
The type of fitting acceptable at “D” is a _____.
Of the following fittings, the one that would be approved at “E” is the _____.

The minimum size (diameter) of the tailpiece for the floor drain served by “A” is _____.
The minimum size (diameter) for branch “A” is _____.

options.text: the cross-sectional area of the drain pipe served
one-half the inside cross-sectional area of the drain pipe served
the size of the uppermost trap
one-half the size of the uppermost trap

questions.text: Long mains shall be provided with relief vents at intervals of _____.
The vent connection “B” shall be _____.

options.text: within 15 feet of the fixture discharging the most total volume of waste
within 15 feet of the uppermost fixture
taken off above the centerline of the drain pipe and downstream of the trap being served

questions.text: Horizontal wet venting _____.

options.text: is not permitted by the code
shall be permitted for public bathrooms
shall be permitted for a bathroom group located on the same floor level
shall be a minimum 4 inches in size

questions.text: The fixture that serves as a dry vent connection to the horizontal wet vent is a _____.
The vent system shall be designed to prevent a trap seal from being exposed to a pressure differential on the outlet side of the trap that exceeds _____ inch of a water column.
A horizontal wet vent shall be not less than two inches in diameter for _____ dfu or less.
The dry vent connection to the wet vent shall be a (an) _____.
The fixture drain or trap arm connection to the wet vent shall be downstream of fixture drain or trap arm connections to the horizontal branch.
An engineered vent system shall be designed by _____ and approved in accordance with Section 301. 5.
What is the maximum number of fixtures permitted on a circuit vent to be connected to a horizontal branch drain? _____
From the most downstream fixture drain connection on a circuit vent to the most upstream fixture drain connection to the horizontal branch, the horizontal branch drain shall be classified as a _____.
What is the minimum number of circuit vents required to vent 21 fixtures? _____
What is the minimum size circuit vent? _____
The vent section of the horizontal branch drain shall slope not more than _____.
Multiple circuit vented branches shall be permitted to connect _____.

options.text: on all floors above the 2nd floor

questions.text: A 2 inch relief vent shall be provided for circuit-vented horizontal branches receiving the discharge of _____ or more water closets.
Fixtures, other than circuit vented fixtures, located on the same floor as circuit-vented fixtures shall be either common vented or _____.
Where exposed to sunlight, ABS and PVC vent piping penetrating the roof shall be protected by _____.
